subtitle: This magnificently rich dessert is perfect for special occasions.

method.text: Sift the flour and cocoa together in a bowl.
In a bowl over a pan of hot water, whisk eggs and sugar together until light, creamy and doubled in bulk. Remove from heat. Whisk until cold and thick.
Using a large metal spoon, gradually fold in the flour mixture very gently. fold in the butter. Pour into a base lined, lightly greased and floured 23 cm round spring-clip cake tin.
Bake in the oven for about 40 min until firm to touch. Leave to cool for a few minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
For the icing, cream the butter and icing sugar together until light and creamy. Stir in the melted chocolate.
Cut the sponge into 3 slices horizontally, and sprinkle the whisky over each layer of sponge. Using half the buttercream, lightly spread over each layer of sponge and sandwich together.

Lightly coat the sides of the cake with half the remaining buttercream using a palette knife. Coat with chocolate vermicelli. Spoon the remaining buttercream into one piping bag, fitted with a star nozzle. Spoon the double cream into another piping bag, also fitted with a star nozzle.
Pipe alternate swirls of buttercream and cream on the top of the cake. Top with the raspberries and a little extra vermicelli. Serve in slices.

title: Chocolate gateau with whisky
